docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Despite the adoption by all 50 states of the 21-year-old legal drinking age and the tightening of alcohol policies on virtually every campus, most college students continue to drink regularly and often heavily.

headline.main: College Drinking: Changes in Attitude and Habit

docs.snippet: LEAD: Despite the adoption by all 50 states of the 21-year-old legal drinking age and the tightening of alcohol policies on virtually every campus, most college students continue to drink regularly and often heavily.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AMERICA is noisier than ever, audiologists say, and the costs may include lost hearing, impaired health, reduced learning ability and antisocial behavior.

headline.main: Research On Noise Disappears In the Din

docs.snippet: LEAD: AMERICA is noisier than ever, audiologists say, and the costs may include lost hearing, impaired health, reduced learning ability and antisocial behavior.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The number of jobs in American health care is soaring at a rate three times faster than the growth of the population, troubling experts concerned about the sharp rise in the nation's medical costs. Thirty-seven of every 1,000 Americans worked in health care last year, compared with about 28 for every 1,000 just 10 years earlier.

headline.main: Job Growth in Health Care Soars
